content: the material of choice for this build is XPS insulation foam if you don't know
what that is but what if I don't have XPS insulation foam hey guys welcome
back to black magic crafts I love building terrain out of XPS insulation
foam but I realized that some of you may not be able to get your hands on it or
you might not want to invest in the tools to work with it so this video is
for you first of all thin foam let's say you can get XPS foam but you don't have
a hot wire table to shave it down there are some options you may not have
considered to get thin material food containers in a lot of places egg
cartons and meat packing trays actually come packed on very thin XPS foam that
is great for doing things like brickwork or shingles now I don't recommend you go
and start building terrain out of your ecoli covered foam that came with your
chicken breast but you may be able to get your hands on some of these packing
trays in bulk brand-new for very cheap talk to your butcher talk to your grocer
talk to whatever shipping container place you have a place like Uline if you
have that will sell this stuff in bulk for very cheap you just got to think
outside the box a bit but let's say that's not an option there's actually
another food container that is a serious contender for using to build terrain and
doing things like bricks and shingles and that is the paper egg cartons this
material has been on my mind for a while and I've been meaning to test it and
after doing last week's eggs Hut build which you should check
out if you haven't yet I thought well that is such a cool project but what if
you want to do it you don't cut the foam egg carton this is perfect so I finally
decided to test out this material to see how it would work to make individual
bricks or stones on the facade of a building and I
got to say I was incredibly impressed with the results of this test these egg
cartons can easily be cut up with a knife or scissors to create stones and
bricks but I found that while doing my tests that it was actually easier to cut
the things like the stones using a small pair of nail scissors than it was to use
a full-sized pair it's pretty quick to do and it really doesn't take that much
effort strips can also be cut with a blade and a straightedge those strips
can then be broken down into individual bricks the really amazing thing about
this material is that well at least on the egg cartons I had one side of the
paper is heavily textured in a way that is absolutely perfect for stones and
bricks these stones can then be glued to a variety of surfaces using PVA glue or
better yet tacky glue because they are paper they grab and bond really well and
really quickly the other nice thing about them being paper is that you can
actually dip them in a little bit of water to soften them up and bend them
around curves laying them out on a surface is just as easy and quick if not
easier than doing it with foam I decided to paint my test piece the same way I
would with foam which meant first coating it with my Mod Podge and black
paint primer because they are paper they actually have the advantage of being
able to be safely spray-painted with any spray paint something you can't do with
foam but I felt the Mod pod would still be useful to seal them and make them
water-resistant when doing the washes they paint up really well and all of
that natural texture on the paper was great for dry brushing the texture was
fantastic for the wash step and I'd argue the texture was more defined than
you can easily achieve with foam when I first set out to do this test I
thought I'd be presenting a cheap alternative to foam stonework but in the
end I think I actually ended up with a technique that's a really good
competitor to foam bricks there are many advantages to using this paper for
bricks I it's really easy it's really cheap it's fast it can be spray-painted
without risk of melting and the texture that's already naturally on it it's
fantastic color me impressed so impressed that I
may actually use this technique in future builds I don't know that it will
replace foam for me but I'll definitely be trying it again on an actual piece
even if it's not better it's nice to have that different change of paste and
material to kind of break up the monotony that can kind of come along
with building a lot of stuff out of the same material all the time whether or
not you decide to use the paper for bricks it's kind of besides the point
the real message I'd like to share here is that sometimes you really need to
think outside the box when building hobby stuff you might not be able to get
the same tools and supplies that I use and that's okay that really shouldn't
stop you from building things there is an infinite number of possible materials
to use to build the same things I do you just really gotta try different things
and this is just one of them so if you found this video helpful hit that like
button and let me know in the comments section below and feel free to drop your
own material of choice as an alternative if you've got some other thing that
people should try if you do want to go out and pick up some tools or supplies
to build this stuff and help the channel in the process you can do so by going to
black magic crafts CA there I have my central equipment store
I got Amazon links to all of the stuff that I actually use and recommend and
purchasing through those links actually helps fund these videos because they are
Amazon affiliate links it's a great way to help the channel at no extra cost to
you also if you really love these videos you find them helpful and you want to
help me keep making them every week the best way you can do that is by
supporting black magic crafts on patreon those funds are crucial to allowing me
to dedicate so much time and effort into producing these videos for you guys
and I'd love to have you as the newest member of the black magic crafts
fellowship and before we go I want to say a quick thank you to Scott over at
mini AK if you were not familiar with his channel you've got to go check it
out he makes way better videos than I do he's incredibly talented at video
production and he is a phenomenal miniature painter check it out if you
have not given me any acts of love because it is one of the best hobby
channels on the platform that's it for this week guys Cheers
see you again next week
